titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Warren Platner Records
titlestmt.author: Laura Tatum, Olivia Stewart, Suzanne Noruschat, and Lauramay LaChance

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday April 24, 2019 at 07:54

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The records contain drawings, photographs, correspondence, job files, and publicity records documenting the career of Warren Platner as an architect and designer. The records include extensive documentation of major projects, such as Standard Brands, Kent Memorial Library, Sea Containers, Windows on the World at the World Trade Center, and Water Tower Place. The records document Platner's career as an associate at the offices of both Eero Saarinen and Kevin Roche John Dinkeloo, as well as his independent work. The collection contains only minimal documentation of Platner's furniture designs for Knoll.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright interests in the collection materials held by the estate of Warren Platner have been transferred by the donor to Yale University. Nonetheless, the collection materials may contain content owned by third-party copyright holders. Determination of the copyright status of specific material may require extensive research, and it is the responsibility of researchers and others intending to use the materials to secure permission of the appropriate copyright holder(s). All other uses not requiring permission of third-party copyright holders are permitted only in accordance with the restrictions and requirements specified herein.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Warren Platner Records (MS 1874). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Joseph Warren Platner was born on June 18, 1919, in Baltimore, Maryland. After graduating from Cornell in 1941, he worked in the architecture offices of both I. M. Pei and Eero Saarinen. After Saarinen's death, Platner continued to work as head of interior design for Kevin Roche John Dinkeloo and Associates, collaborating most significantly on the Ford Foundation headquarters building in New York. In 1955, he was awarded the Rome Prize for architecture. Platner opened his own firm, Platner Associates, in New Haven in the late 1960s, and is known best for his line of furniture designed for Knoll, his interiors for Water Tower Place in Chicago and Windows on the World in New York, and renovations of the Yale Club and the Pan Am/MetLife Building, also in New York. He was inducted into the Interior Design Magazine Hall of Fame in 1985. Platner died on April 20, 2006, in New Haven, Connecticut.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The records contain drawings, photographs, correspondence, job files, and publicity records documenting the career of Warren Platner as an architect and designer. The records include extensive documentation of major projects, such as Standard Brands, Kent Memorial Library, Sea Containers, Windows on the World at the World Trade Center, and Water Tower Place. The records document Platner's career as an associate at the offices of both Eero Saarinen and Kevin Roche John Dinkeloo, as well as his independent work. The collection contains only minimal documentation of Platner's furniture designs for Knoll.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

Original audiovisual materials, as well as preservation and duplicating masters, may not be played. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist must pay for a use copy, which is retained by the repository. Researchers wishing to obtain an additional copy for their personal use should consult Copying Services information on the Manuscripts and Archives web site.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The records are arranged alphabetically by project.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: For a list of projects and the boxes in which project materials are located, please consult theProject Index.
